info.description:
Get the parameters api_endpoint, app_id, and access-token from Console before calling Lanying IM API, 
api_endpoint is the service address, app_id and access-token are used in request Header. The default type of request Content-Type is application/json.
info.title: Lanying IM server-side API document

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: This field can be set only if access-token is an Admin token, means call this interface as an Admin for this group ID

parameters.name: thumbnail_strategy
parameters.description: Thumbnail generation policy, 1 - generated by third-party server, 2 - generated by local server, default 1

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: This field can be set only if access-token is a user token, means call this interface as a group member for this user ID

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Audio file format to download, amr/mp3, default amr

parameters.description: This field can be set only if access-token is an Admin token, means call this interface as an Admin for this group ID

get.summary: Get the URL of uploading chat file

parameters.name: file_type
parameters.description: File Type  100: plain chat file, 101: voice chat file (in .amr), 102: picture chat file, 103: video chat file, 104: voice chat file (in .mp3), 200: shared plain file, 201: shared voice file, 202: shared picture file, 203: shared video file

Flyme.description: Meizu vendor extra parameter, can be blank; if set, will override the corresponding attribute in Android

ban_expire_time.description: Expiration time (second), during which only Admins are allowed to send messages, 0 or less than the current time means no banning, -1 means banned permanently

apply_approval.description: Group membership application settings, 0: Agree all requests 1: Need to confirm by Admin 2: Reject all requests

ban_expire_time.description: Expiration time (second), during which only Admins are allowed to send messages, 0 or less than the current time means no banning, -1 means banned permanently

history_visible.description: History chat visibility settings for new members: true - New members can see chat history, false - New members invisible chat history

member_invite.description: Whether to allow group members to invite others into the group: true - Group members are allowed to invite others into the group, false - Group members are not allowed to invite others into the group

member_modify.description: Group members modify group information settings: true - Allow group members to modify group information, false - Do not allow group members to modify group information

msg_mute_mode.description: Group message blocking mode: 0 - not blocking, 1 - blocking local message notifications, 2 - blocking messages, not receiving messages

msg_push_mode.description: Group message push mode: 0 - receive all pushes, 1 - not accept pushes, 2 - receive admin and @message pushes, 3 - only receive admin pushes, 4 - only receive @message pushes

read_ack.description: Whether to enable the read function of group messages: true - enable the read function of group messages, false - disable the read function of group messages

user_list.description: List of user ids invited to join group

status.description: Status: 0 - Pending, 1 - User agreed, 2 - User rejected

user_list.description: Invitee id, List type, multiple users can be invited to a group at one time

msg_mute_mode.description: Group message blocking mode: 0 - No blocking1 - Block local message notification2 - Block message, no message received

msg_push_mode.description: Group message push type: 0: Receive all pushes; 1: Do not accept push; 2: Receive Admin and @ pushes; 3. Only receive Admin pushes; 4: Only receive @ pushes

apply_approval.description: Group membership application settings, 0: Agree all requests 1: Need to confirm by Admin 2: Reject all requests

targets.description: Receive user ID or group ID

transaction_id.description: Request ID, which is used for message deduplication. If two requests with the same transaction_id are received in a short time, the second request will not be executed. No deduplication when request ID is not set.

sound.description: Message alert sound, can be blank

channel_id.description: Notification bar channel, can be blank

OPPO.description: Oppo vendor extra parameter, can be blank; if set, will override the corresponding attribute in Android

online.description: Online or not: true - online, false - offline

version.description: Version, not used at present, reserved for extension
Version, not used at present, reserved for extension
Version, not used at present, reserved for extension
Version, not used at present, reserved for extension

type.description: Message type:text - text,image - image, cmd - pass-through message. Can be blank, which means text by default

attachment_url.description: Attachment address: URL address of image/audio/video, can be blank. If it is an image address, it needs to end with .jpg/jpeg/png, and the picture size should be less than 1M. 876*324 px is recommended

big_text.description: Large text: If this field is set and the vendor supports pushing large text, use this field to push large text; Otherwise, use the body field to push ordinary text

badge.description: Badge: If it is a number, modify the badge to this number; If starts with +, means adding this number to badge, ex. \“+1\” means adding 1 to badge; If blank, default "+1"

ext.description: Extension field:Can be empty, the type is JSONObject, for example: {"key1":123, "key2":"value2"}

show_begin_time.description: Start timestamp of timed presentation (seconds), blank for immediate presentation

show_end_time.description: End timestamp of timed presentation (seconds), can be blank

ios.description: Android extra parameter, can be blank

android.description: ios extra parameter, can be blank

audience.description:
Target of push, cannot be blank. Type is string or JSONObject:
"all", means push to all devices
{"tag":["tag1","tag2"]} means push to devices labeled tag1 or tag2
{"alias":["alias1","alias2"]} means push to devices with alias1 or alias2
{"user_id":[111,222]} means push to devices with user ID 111 or 222
{"push_token":["push_token1","push_token2"]} means push to devices with PushToken push_token1 or push_token2
List length cannot exceed 500 when pushed with tag/alias/user ID/pushToken

message.description: Message body pushed, cannot be blank

qr_info.description: QR code information:It can be obtained by GET /group/qrcode/sign

status.description: Status: 0 - waiting for confirmation, 1 - accepted, 2 - rejected

user_id.description: User ID that initiate adding friend

RosterApplicationDto.title: RosterApplicationDto
RosterApplicationDto.description: List entries of adding friend request

mute_notification.description: Mute message notification: true - mute message notification, false - do not mute message notification

auth_mode.description: Verification method: 0 - No verification, anyone can be added as a friend; 1 - consent is required to be added as a friend; 2 - answer questions correctly to be added as a friend; 3 - reject all adding friend requests

mute_notification.description: Mute message notification: true - mute message notification, false - do not mute message notification

public_info.description: Public information, visible to both friends and strangers

relation.description: Relationships: 0 - friend, 1 - deleted friend, 2 - stranger, 3 - blacklist

request_id.description: Request ID for request deduplication, not pushed if request ID has been present before. Can be blank, which means no deduplication.

distribution_strategy.description: Notification distribution strategy: combined- means to use Lanying channel to distribute first, and if Lanying is not online, use vendor channel to distribute; Mxpush_only- indicates that only the Lanying channel is used for distribution; Ospush_only- indicates that only the vendor channel is used for distribution. Can be empty, which defaults to combined

ospush_sequence.description: Vendor push priority: ups - domestic vendors (Xiaomi/Huawei/Meizu/oppo/vivo); fcm - FCM push; Huawei - Huawei push; Xiaomi - Xiaomi push; Oppo - OPPO push; Vivo - Vivo push, Meizu - Meizu push. Can be empty, which defaults to [ups, fcm]

apns_target.description: Valid target number on APNs channel

fcm_target.description: Valid target number on FCM channel

flyme_target.description: Valid target number on Meizu channel

huawei_target.description: Valid target number on Huawei channel

mxpush_target.description: Valid target number on Lanying channel

oppo_target.description: Valid target number on oppo channel

vivo_target.description: Valid target number on vivo channel

xiaomi_target.description: Valid target number on Xiaomi channel

token.description: Access token, The access-token when calling the API

device_guid.description: Device ID, if set, returns PushToken

login_name.description: Login name, which can be mobile number, email, username

user_id.description: User ID, for login by user ID only

name.description: Username, for login by username only

password.description: User password: if it is a user TOKEN, this field needs to be set; if it is an administrator TOKEN, it does not need to be set

private_info.description: Private information, visible only to yourself

UserProfileRequest.description: Update user request information, can be omitted except ID, only fields with content to be updated

auth_mode.description: Verification method: 0 - No verification, anyone can be added as a friend; 1 - consent is required to be added as a friend; 2 - answer questions correctly to be added as a friend; 3 - reject all adding friend requests

auto_download.description: Whether to automatically download: true - automatic download, false - no automatic download

group_confirm.description: Whether user consent is required when inviting to join group: true - user consent is required, false - invitation is automatically agreed

no_push.description: Whether to turn off push messages: true - turn off push messages, false - do not turn off push messages

no_push_detail.description: Whether to push details: true - push details, false - don't push details

no_sounds.description: Whether to mute when a message is received: true - mute, false - not mute

vibratory.description: Whether to vibrate when a message is received: true - vibrate, false - not vibrate

classification.description: Message type: 0 - operational message; 1 - system message. Default 0

is_last.description: Whether it is the last message: true - there are no more messages to follow, false - there are more messages to follow

next_msg_id.description: the message ID that needs to be set to pull the messages: Set this message ID to msg_id_start of the request parameter to continue to pull the message
